resources.string: Move the writable tag and your phone close each other.

This program is still under development!

This software is provided "as is" and without any express or implied warranties, including, without limitation, the implied waranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose.

Please report issues and new feature requests to sami.viitanen@gmail.com

Thanks!

Credits

Programming and Graphics
Sami Viitanen

Testing and Special Thanks
---
Copyright Sami Viitanen 2011, All rights reserved.

Known limitations

* Only for A2DP audio devices (=speakers). Headsets still need some work.

* Only works with different Mifare Ultralight tags

* Automatic PIN code handling for devices still missing. Devices with 0000 PIN code might work.

This application allows you to write Bluetooth connectivity information to NFC tags. These tags can be then used for easy connecting between your Bluetooth devices and Android phone. Connecting and disconnecting happens simply by touch the tag with your device.
NFC does not seem to be enabled. You have to enable it manually. Tap OK to start settings. Return to this application with back after you are done.
Now please touch writable tag with your phone to write the Bluetooth pairing information.\n\nOnly Mifare Ultralights are supported currently.
Enable write protection of the tag
Bluetooth is now enabled by application to locate the bluetooth device. Bluetooth will be automatically disabled after query is done.
Your device does not support NFC
Please tap your tag with the phone
Notice: Some of the values asked here can not be stored to the smallest tags.
Please enable the pair mode of your Bluetooth device.
No Bluetooth audio devices found. Please check that your Bluetooth devices are turned on, in pairing mode and visible. Then restart the device discovery.
Writing to tag failed.\nPlease check that tag is not write protected. Also keep it close to device while software is writing.
Given tag is too small to contain information needed.
Given tag is unsupported. Try another.
